lead_paragraph: Officials in Yemen are struggling to contain the growing anger of pro-government fighters over delayed payments from the Saudi Arabia-led coalition.

byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, and Nour Youssef from Cairo. Shuaib Almosawa contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen.
byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and NOUR YOUSSEF

headline.print_headline: It’s Not the Bullets Forcing Yemeni Troops Off the Battlefield. It’s the Pay.
headline.main: It’s Not the Bullets Forcing Yemeni Troops Off the Battlefield. It’s the Pay.

snippet: Officials in Yemen are struggling to contain the growing anger of pro-government fighters over delayed payments from the Saudi Arabia-led coalition....
abstract: Yemeni officials are fighting to keep pro-government fighters from leaving their posts in battle against Houthi rebels; at issue for soldiers is lag in payment from supporting Saudi-led Arab coalition.
